tidy a power.htest

Source: R/stats_tidiers.R
tidy.power.htest.Rd

tidy a power.htest

# S3 method for power.htest
tidy(x, ...)

Arguments

x

a power.htest object
...

extra arguments, not used

Value

A data frame with one row per parameter passed in, with columns n, delta, sd, sig.level, and power (from the power.htest object).

See also

power.t.test

Examples


ptt <- power.t.test(n = 2:30, delta = 1)
tidy(ptt)
#>     n delta sd sig.level      power
#> 1   2     1  1      0.05 0.09131778
#> 2   3     1  1      0.05 0.15723610
#> 3   4     1  1      0.05 0.22246334
#> 4   5     1  1      0.05 0.28592760
#> 5   6     1  1      0.05 0.34715648
#> 6   7     1  1      0.05 0.40569712
#> 7   8     1  1      0.05 0.46117590
#> 8   9     1  1      0.05 0.51332563
#> 9  10     1  1      0.05 0.56198462
#> 10 11     1  1      0.05 0.60708444
#> 11 12     1  1      0.05 0.64863435
#> 12 13     1  1      0.05 0.68670551
#> 13 14     1  1      0.05 0.72141656
#> 14 15     1  1      0.05 0.75292102
#> 15 16     1  1      0.05 0.78139651
#> 16 17     1  1      0.05 0.80703589
#> 17 18     1  1      0.05 0.83004003
#> 18 19     1  1      0.05 0.85061204
#> 19 20     1  1      0.05 0.86895280
#> 20 21     1  1      0.05 0.88525761
#> 21 22     1  1      0.05 0.89971365
#> 22 23     1  1      0.05 0.91249830
#> 23 24     1  1      0.05 0.92377799
#> 24 25     1  1      0.05 0.93370763
#> 25 26     1  1      0.05 0.94243026
#> 26 27     1  1      0.05 0.95007724
#> 27 28     1  1      0.05 0.95676841
#> 28 29     1  1      0.05 0.96261263
#> 29 30     1  1      0.05 0.96770825

library(ggplot2)
ggplot(tidy(ptt), aes(n, power)) + geom_line()
